## Defines

### llvm&#95;unreachable {#ace243f5c25697a1107cce46626b3dc94}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>#define llvm&#95;unreachable&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8cb1f2bd469f8a823857a1cf1447a0e3">::llvm::llvm&#95;unreachable&#95;internal</a>(msg, &#95;&#95;FILE&#95;&#95;, &#95;&#95;LINE&#95;&#95;)</>}>
Marks that the current location is not supposed to be reachable.

In !NDEBUG builds, prints the message and location info to stderr. In NDEBUG builds, if the platform does not support a builtin unreachable then we call an internal LLVM runtime function. Otherwise the behavior is controlled by the CMake flag -DLLVM&#95;UNREACHABLE&#95;OPTIMIZE
<ul>
<li>When &quot;ON&quot; (default) <a href="#ace243f5c25697a1107cce46626b3dc94">llvm&#95;unreachable()</a> becomes an optimizer hint that the current location is not supposed to be reachable: the hint turns such code path into undefined behavior. On compilers that don&#39;t support such hints, prints a reduced message instead and aborts the program.</li>
<li>When &quot;OFF&quot;, a builtin&#95;trap is emitted instead of an Use this instead of assert(0). It conveys intent more clearly, suppresses diagnostics for unreachable code paths, and allows compilers to omit unnecessary code.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="#l00143">143</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/errorhandling-h">ErrorHandling.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// install&#95;fatal&#95;error&#95;handler - Installs a new error handler to be used</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// whenever a serious (non-recoverable) error is encountered by LLVM.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If no error handler is installed the default is to print the error message</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to stderr, and call exit(1).  If an error handler is installed then it is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the handler&#39;s responsibility to log the message, it will no longer be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// printed to stderr.  If the error handler returns, then exit(1) will be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// called.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// It is dangerous to naively use an error handler which throws an exception.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Even though some applications desire to gracefully recover from arbitrary</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// faults, blindly throwing exceptions through unfamiliar code isn&#39;t a way to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// achieve this.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Reports a serious error, calling any installed error handler. These</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">/// functions are intended to be used for error conditions which are outside</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the control of the compiler (I/O errors, invalid user input, etc.)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If no error handler is installed the default is to print the message to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">/// standard error, followed by a newline.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">/// After the error handler is called this function will call abort(), it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">/// does not return.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">/// NOTE: The std::string variant was removed to avoid a &lt;string&gt; dependency.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Installs a new bad alloc error handler that should be used whenever a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">/// bad alloc error, e.g. failing malloc/calloc, is encountered by LLVM.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The user can install a bad alloc handler, in order to define the behavior</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">/// in case of failing allocations, e.g. throwing an exception. Note that this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">/// handler must not trigger any additional allocations itself.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If no error handler is installed the default is to print the error message</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to stderr, and call exit(1).  If an error handler is installed then it is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the handler&#39;s responsibility to log the message, it will no longer be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">/// printed to stderr.  If the error handler returns, then exit(1) will be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">/// called.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\param user&#95;data - An argument which will be passed to the installed error</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">/// handler.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Reports a bad alloc error, calling any user defined bad alloc</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">/// error handler. In contrast to the generic &#39;report&#95;fatal&#95;error&#39;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">/// functions, this function might not terminate, e.g. the user</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">/// defined error handler throws an exception, but it won&#39;t return.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note: When throwing an exception in the bad alloc handler, make sure that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the following unwind succeeds, e.g. do not trigger additional allocations</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">/// in the unwind chain.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If no error handler is installed (default), throws a bad&#95;alloc exception</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">/// if LLVM is compiled with exception support. Otherwise prints the error</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to standard error and calls abort().</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="normal">&#91;&#91;noreturn&#93;&#93; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#afcd76d92f6ad67759238ccef6ec883af">report&#95;bad&#95;alloc&#95;error</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;Reason,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="normal">                                         </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> GenCrashDiag = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This function calls abort(), and prints the optional message to stderr.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Use the llvm&#95;unreachable macro (that adds location info), instead of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">/// calling this function directly.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal">&#91;&#91;noreturn&#93;&#93; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8cb1f2bd469f8a823857a1cf1447a0e3">llvm&#95;unreachable&#95;internal</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;msg = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/regionprinter-cpp/#a79dce2d3eafaf25bf0df59f56caf9712">file</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="normal">                          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> line = 0);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Marks that the current location is not supposed to be reachable.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="comment">/// In !NDEBUG builds, prints the message and location info to stderr.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">/// In NDEBUG builds, if the platform does not support a builtin unreachable</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">/// then we call an internal LLVM runtime function. Otherwise the behavior is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">/// controlled by the CMake flag</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">///   -DLLVM&#95;UNREACHABLE&#95;OPTIMIZE</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; When &quot;ON&quot; (default) llvm&#95;unreachable() becomes an optimizer hint</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">///   that the current location is not supposed to be reachable: the hint</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">///   turns such code path into undefined behavior.  On compilers that don&#39;t</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">///   support such hints, prints a reduced message instead and aborts the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="comment">///   program.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; When &quot;OFF&quot;, a builtin&#95;trap is emitted instead of an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    optimizer hint or printing a reduced message.</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Use this instead of assert(0). It conveys intent more clearly, suppresses</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="comment">/// diagnostics for unreachable code paths, and allows compilers to omit</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="comment">/// unnecessary code.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#ifndef NDEBUG</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143" lineLink="#ace243f5c25697a1107cce46626b3dc94"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define llvm&#95;unreachable(msg) \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  ::llvm::llvm&#95;unreachable&#95;internal(msg, &#95;&#95;FILE&#95;&#95;, &#95;&#95;LINE&#95;&#95;)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#elif !defined(LLVM&#95;BUILTIN&#95;UNREACHABLE)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define llvm&#95;unreachable(msg) ::llvm::llvm&#95;unreachable&#95;internal()</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#elif LLVM&#95;UNREACHABLE&#95;OPTIMIZE</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define llvm&#95;unreachable(msg) LLVM&#95;BUILTIN&#95;UNREACHABLE</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define llvm&#95;unreachable(msg)                                                  \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  do &#123;                                                                         \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">    LLVM&#95;BUILTIN&#95;TRAP;                                                         \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">    LLVM&#95;BUILTIN&#95;UNREACHABLE;                                                  \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  &#125; while (false)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#endif</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#endif</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>
